intro: Guatteria costaricensis var. endresii, commonly known as the Costa Rican guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central America, particularly Costa Rica and Panama. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. The fruit is a small, fleshy berry that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
